rename.from: Deprecation detail listing not emitted when testdox=true
rename.to: Display PHPUnit deprecations when TestDox output is used

body:
I understand that you think this is a bug because PHPUnit does not behave as you expect it to behave. However, the current behaviour is the intended one: I did not want to "clutter" the TestDox output with deprecations.

I now think that deprecations coming from PHPUnit should also be displayed in TestDox output.

Thanks for the quick feedback on this. NB: now that I know how to get the feedback (and the deprecations dealt with: my bad!) it's not a significant concern for me. Perhaps a note in the docs might help ppl understand what's currently going on?

Cheers for all your hard work pal.

I have a similar issue in this phpunit test method:

```php
// ...
$response = $this->app->handle($request);
```

Output: 

```
OK, but some tests have issues!
Tests: 10, Assertions: 32, Deprecations: 1.
```

When I remove this line, the deprecation warning is gone. This happens only in phpunit 10.
Is there a way to get more details about this deprecation issue? Is this a bug in phpunit 10?

> Is there a way to get more details about this deprecation issue?

Please do not update to a new version, a new major version no less, without reading the [ChangeLog](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/10.0.0/ChangeLog-10.0.md#added). You are looking for `--display-deprecations`.

Ok, thanks for pointing that out. In my specific case, it was this warning:

```
Since symfony/validator 6.2: The "loose" mode is deprecated. The default mode will be changed to "html5" in 7.0.
```

This is a really nice feature. Thanks :-)

> I understand that you think this is a bug because PHPUnit does not behave as you expect it to behave. However, the current behaviour is the intended one: I did not want to "clutter" the TestDox output with deprecations.
> 
> I now think that deprecations coming from PHPUnit should also be displayed in TestDox output.

Does the same logic apply to why Errors, Warnings etc are not shown when using `--testdox`?

The errors (e.g. `TypeError`) are shown in my config if I run phpunit without the `--testdox` option.

I might be using that option outside of its intent, but I like the verbosity it gives (listing up each test with a ✔or ✘ in front of them) over the default progress indicator. Now there's seems to be no way debug those Errors without changing my composer script every time, or is there another way?

issue.title: Allow excluding warnings on the usage of deprecated symbols

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

issue.body:
After updating to PHPUnit 10, I have noticed it prints some warnings when tests are using symbols marked as deprecated.

While I think this might be useful when it comes to third party code (although I'm not sure if PHPUnit is the kind of tool that should highlight this, and it might fall more into the static analysis world, but that's a different story), it is a bit inconvenient when it complains about deprecated symbols from the project itself.

I have a couple of deprecated things that I intend to remove on the next major version, but while they are in the project, I also want to keep their tests around. When I remove these, I will remove their tests as well.

And I know this is not making the tests fail in any way, but it can distract you from actual warnings that should be addressed.

Because of this, it would be great to be able to either disable this check entirely (making it behave as PHPUnit 9), or disable it for certain namespaces/paths.

issue.title: Mention dependencies between config-attributes in section "The XML Configuration File"
issue.body:
Hey there and thanks for the great work!

I stumbled over a tiny issue that might be worth mentioning in the docs which is:

    testdox=true

will stop deprecation-details from printing and it doesn't seem like there is a way to get both testdox-printing and deprecation-details-printing at the same time. At least I didn't find one.

If this is intended behaviour and not my lack of ability to do proper research, I personally would have profited from it being documented in https://docs.phpunit.de/en/10.0/configuration.html#the-testdox-attribute .

I guess this would generally be useful for possibly dependent behaviour between config-attributes.

body:
My understanding based on the issues,also https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5198 and comments linked to this is that now phpunit should actually show deprecation messages even when testDox is `true``   however they are still hidden for me even if using the last version 10.1.3 and using all the configurations or command line options to indeed show the deprecation messages. 
Here is a self contained example that shows this error. I did not open another ticket to ensure I am not adding anything redundant so please let me know if you think I missed something.

https://github.com/bizmate/phpunittest

it works as follows with testdox and deprecation details:

```
<phpunit displayDetailsOnTestsThatTriggerDeprecations="true">
  <source ignoreSuppressionOfDeprecations="true">
    ...
  </source>
</phpunit>
```
